inference:
The white triangle has legs of length 6 and 8.  The hypotenuse is 10.  The area of the white triangle is (1/2)(6)(8) = 24.  The shaded rectangle has width 3 and height 12.  The area of the shaded rectangle is (3)(12) = 36.  The area of the small triangle on the left is (1/2)(1)(6) = 3. The area of the small triangle on the right is (1/2)(1)(3) = 1.5.  The area of the unshaded triangle inside the large triangle is 24-3-1.5=19.5.  The shaded area is the rectangle's area minus the unshaded triangle's area. The shaded area is 36 - 19.5 = 16.5.
Final Answer: $\boxed{16.5}$

question:
The white triangle has legs of length 6 and 8.  The hypotenuse is 10.  The area of the white triangle is (1/2)(6)(8) = 24.  The shaded rectangle has width 3 and height 12.  The area of the shaded rectangle is (3)(12) = 36.  The area of the small triangle on the left is (1/2)(1)(6) = 3. The area of the small triangle on the right is (1/2)(1)(3) = 1.5. There might be an error in the solution above because of lack of understanding of the question. Please correct the error, if any, and rewrite the solution. Only output the final solution \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
inference:
Let the white triangle have legs of length 6 and 8. The hypotenuse is 10.
The area of the white triangle is (1/2)(6)(8) = 24.
The shaded rectangle has width 3 and height 12. The area of the shaded rectangle is (3)(12) = 36.
The small triangle on the left has one leg of length 1 and the other leg of length 6, so its area is (1/2)(1)(6) = 3.
The small triangle on the right has one leg of length 1 and the other leg of length 3, so its area is (1/2)(1)(3) = 1.5.
The unshaded area is the area of the white triangle minus the area of the two smaller triangles.  
Unshaded area = 24 - 3 - 1.5 = 19.5.
The shaded area is the rectangle's area minus the unshaded area.
Shaded area = 36 - 19.5 = 16.5.

$\boxed{16.5}$
